text: {"grade": 0, "reasoning": "The criterion requires the response to state that the determination of whether the drunk driver's actions were an intervening cause is partially dependent on how long the chair was in the road prior to the swerving (to determine whether the drunk driver could reasonably have seen the chair in time to avoid it without swerving). The candidate answer discusses the foreseeability of the drunk driver's reaction and the culpability of the intoxication, but it does not explicitly link the duration the chair was in the road (visibility/opportunity to avoid) to the legal analysis of whether the swerving constituted a *novus actus interveniens* for the truck driver. It mentions 'opportunity to avoid' generally in section 2(B) regarding the truck driver's liability, but not specifically in the context of assessing the drunk driver's reaction as an intervening cause.", "criterion_id": "53430ddb-2da1-464a-af19-ff799ad6064e"}
